msContents.summary: A Karaim translation of the Torah and the Haftarah

ab.l: And Abram went from Egypt, he, and his wife, and all thathe had, and Lot with him, southward.
AndAbram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold.
And he went on his journeys from the south even as far as to Bethelto the place where his tent had been at the beginning,between Bethel and Ai,
To the placeof the altar, which he had made there at the beginning: and there Abram calledupon the name of the Lord.
And Lot, who was goingwith Abram, also had sheep, and cattle, and tents.
And the land was not able to give place to them, that they might dwell together, becausetheir property were great, so that they could not dwell together.
And there was a strife between the herdsmen of Abram’s cattleand the herdsmen of Lot’s cattle:and the Canaanites and the Perizzites dwelt thenin the land.
And Abram said to Lot, ‘I pray you,let there be no strife between you and me, and between my herdsmenand your herdsmen, because we are kinsmen.
Lo, the whole land is before you, separatenow yourself from me, if you go to the left, then let me go to the right,and if you go to the right, then let me go to the left.’

And Lot raised his eyes and saw all the valley of Jordanthat it was all |well-|watered, before the Lord destroyedSodom and Gomorrah, like the garden of the Lord,like the land of Egypt, in the direction as you came to Zoar.
SoLot chose for himself all the valley of Jordan, and Lot journeyedeast. And they separated, the one from his brother.
Abram settled in the land of Canaan, and Lotin the cities of the valley. And he pitched his tent as far as Sodom.
But the men of Sodom were evil and sinned greatlybefore the Lord.
And the Lord said to Abram,after Lot was separated from him, ‘Lift up now your eyes,and look from the place where you are northward, and southward,and eastward, and westward.
For all the landthat you see, I will give to you and to your offspring forever.
And I will set your offspring like the dustof the earth, so that if a man could count the dust of the earth,your offspring also could be counted.
Arise, walk through the landto its length and to its width, because I will give it to you.’
SoAbram pitched his tent and lived in the plain lands of Mamre,which is in Hebron, and built there an altar before the Lord.
